job.name: JS7RESTClientJob
job.title: Send Requst to a JOC API

note.title: JSON for the API Request
note.p:
JSON Object that holds two keys: 
        
1) endpoint: The endpoint of the API. 
Example: If you want to execute a REST request to http://localhost:2101/joc/api/orders/add, then the endpoint will be /orders/add.
        
2) body: Request body/payload for the API specified by the endpoint. 
Example: 
        
        {
            "controllerId": "controller_2102",
            "orders": [{
                "workflowPath": "/JS7RESTClientJob/w1",
                "orderName": "",
                "forceJobAdmission": false,
                "priority": 0,
                "tags": [],
                "arguments": {},
                "scheduledFor": "now"
            }],
            "auditLog": {}
        }

param.name: return_variable
param.note:
JSON Object Array An array of JSON objects, each containing two keys:
1) name: The variable name used to access the value extracted by the JQ query defined in the path key.
2) path: A JQ query to extract a value from a JSON input. Optionally, this key may also contain file output instructions in the format:
[JQ query] || [Processing Instruction] [File Path]
If || is present, it indicates that the query result should be written to a file. In this case, the processing instruction and file path must be provided. Supported processing instructions are:
> : Overwrites the file with the query result.
>> : Appends the query result to the file.
Note: There must be at least one space between the processing instruction and the file path. To get the value from a JQ query you need to place the Jackson-jq Java .jar file inside the JS7_AGENT_HOME/lib/user_lib directory of the Agent see JS7 - REST Client Job.

note.title: Base URLs of JOC Cockpit
note.p: Base URLs of JOC Cockpit separated with | (pipe character).

param.name: js7.api-server.username
param.note:
Username Username can be specified in the following formats:
Plain text
Encrypted value
Reference to a credential that holds the account name

param.name: js7.api-server.password
param.note:
Password Password can be specified in the following formats:
Plain text
Encrypted value
Reference to a credential that holds the passoword

param.name: encipherment_private_key_path
param.note: Path of the Encipherment Private Key Specifies the path to the private key that is used for decryption of username and password settings, see JS7 - Encryption and Decryption. The path must be in reach of the Agent that executes the JITL job.

note.title: Path to the Certificate
note.p: Path to certificate store in PKCS12 format holding the private key and certificate.

note.title: Password of Certificate (keystore)
note.p: Password for access to certificate store.

note.title: Password of Private key
note.p: Password for access to private key.

note.title: Path to the CA Certificate
note.p: List of paths to certificate stores in PKCS12 format holding the CA certificate. If more than one path is specfied, then they are separated by a pipe "|" character.

note.title: Password of Certificate (truststore)
note.p: Password for access to certificate store.

note.title: Path of the KeePass database file
note.p: Specifies the path to a KeePass database file (required if Credential Store is used).

note.title: Path of the KeePass key file
note.p: Specifies the path to a KeePass key file.

note.title: Password of the KeePass database file
note.p: Specifies the password for the KeePass database file.

note.title: Status Code of API Request
note.p: This variable stores the HTTP status code returned by the JOC API request.

documentation.p: The JITL JS7RESTClientJob job template can be used to execute REST requests to JOC Cockpit.
